verses.original: ब्रह्ममुरारिसुरार्चितलिङ्गं निर्मलभासितशोभितलिङ्गम् । जन्मजदुःखविनाशकलिङ्गं तत् प्रणमामि सदाशिवलिङ्गम् ॥
verses.transliteration: brahmamurārisurārcitaliṅgaṁ nirmalabhāsitaśobhitāliṅgam । janmajaduḥkhavināśakaliṅgaṁ tat praṇamāmi sadāśivaliṅgam ॥
verses.translation: I bow to that Sadāśiva Liṅgam which is worshipped by Brahmā, Murāri (Viṣṇu), and the Suras (Gods); which shines with purity and splendor; and which destroys the sorrows arising from the cycle of births.

verses.original: देवमुनिप्रवरार्चितलिङ्गं कामदहं करुणाकरलिङ्गम् । रावणदर्पविनाशकलिङ्गं तत् प्रणमामि सदाशिवलिङ्गम् ॥
verses.transliteration: devamunipravarārcitaliṅgaṁ kāmadahaṁ karuṇākaraliṅgam । rāvaṇadarpa-vināśakaliṅgaṁ tat praṇamāmi sadāśivaliṅgam ॥
verses.translation: I bow to that Sadāśiva Liṅgam which is worshipped by the best among Devas and Sages; which burns Kāma (desire); which is the embodiment of compassion; and which destroyed the pride of Rāvaṇa.

verses.original: सर्वसुगन्धिसुलेपितलिङ्गं बुद्धिविवर्धनकारणलिङ्गम् । सिद्धसुरासुरवन्दितलिङ्गं तत् प्रणमामि सदाशिवलिङ्गम् ॥
verses.transliteration: sarvasugandhisu-lepitaliṅgaṁ buddhivivardhanakāraṇaliṅgam । siddhasurāsuravanditaliṅgaṁ tat praṇamāmi sadāśivaliṅgam ॥
verses.translation: I bow to that Sadāśiva Liṅgam which is smeared with all fragrant perfumes; which is the cause of the growth of intellect and wisdom; and which is venerated by Siddhas, Suras, and Asuras.

verses.original: कनकमहामणिभूषितलिङ्गं फणिपतिवेष्टितशोभितलिङ्गम् । दक्षसुयज्ञविनाशकलिङ्गं तत् प्रणमामि सदाशिवलिङ्गम् ॥
verses.transliteration: kanakamahāmaṇibhūṣitaliṅgaṁ phaṇipativeṣṭitaśobhitāliṅgam । dakṣasuyajñavināśakaliṅgaṁ tat praṇamāmi sadāśivaliṅgam ॥
verses.translation: I bow to that Sadāśiva Liṅgam which is adorned with great jewels and gold; which shines beautifully encircled by the Lord of Serpents (Vāsuki); and which destroyed the great sacrifice (Yajña) of Dakṣa.

verses.original: कुङ्कुमचन्दनलेपितलिङ्गं पङ्कजहारसुपूजितलिङ्गम् । सञ्चितपापविनाशकलिङ्गं तत् प्रणमामि सदाशिवलिङ्गम् ॥
verses.transliteration: kuṅkumacandanalepitaliṅgaṁ paṅkajahārasupūjitaliṅgam । sañcitapāpavināśakaliṅgaṁ tat praṇamāmi sadāśivaliṅgam ॥
verses.translation: I bow to that Sadāśiva Liṅgam which is smeared with saffron and sandalwood paste; which is well-worshipped with garlands of lotus flowers; and which destroys all accumulated sins.

verses.original: देवगणार्चितसेवितलिङ्गं भावैर्भक्तिभिरेव च लिङ्गम् । दिनकरकोटिप्रभाकरलिङ्गं तत् प्रणमामि सदाशिवलिङ्गम् ॥
verses.transliteration: devagaṇārcitasevitāliṅgaṁ bhāvairbhaktibhireva ca liṅgam । dinakarakoṭiprabhākaraliṅgaṁ tat praṇamāmi sadāśivaliṅgam ॥
verses.translation: I bow to that Sadāśiva Liṅgam which is worshipped and served by the hosts of Gods; which is worshipped with devotion and spiritual emotion; and which shines with the splendor of millions of suns.

verses.original: अष्टदलोपरिवेष्टितलिङ्गं सर्वसमुद्भवकारणलिङ्गम् । अष्टदरिद्रविनाशकलिङ्गं तत् प्रणमामि सदाशिवलिङ्गम् ॥
verses.transliteration: aṣṭadalopariveṣṭitaliṅgaṁ sarvasamudbhavakāraṇaliṅgam । aṣṭadaridravināśakaliṅgaṁ tat praṇamāmi sadāśivaliṅgam ॥
verses.translation: I bow to that Sadāśiva Liṅgam which is encircled by eight petals (representing the eight forms of nature); which is the cause of the manifestation of the entire universe; and which destroys the eight types of poverty.

verses.original: सुरगुरुसुरवरपूजितलिङ्गं सुरवनपुष्पसदार्चितलिङ्गम् । परमपदं परमात्मकलिङ्गं तत् प्रणमामि सदाशिवलिङ्गम् ॥
verses.transliteration: suragurusuravarapūjitaliṅgaṁ suravanapuṣpasadārcitaliṅgam । paramapadaṁ paramātmakaliṅgaṁ tat praṇamāmi sadāśivaliṅgam ॥
verses.translation: I bow to that Sadāśiva Liṅgam which is worshipped by the Guru of the Gods (Bṛhaspati) and the best of the Gods; which is ever worshipped with flowers from the celestial garden (Nandanavana); and which is the Supreme Abode and the Liṅgam of the Supreme Soul (Paramātman).
